message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.SI. 

The paper focuses on extracting interactive argument pairs from posts with opposite stances, which involves natural language processing and machine learning techniques. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also utilizes hierarchical structure to model post-wise information, which is a common technique in deep learning and neural networks, suggesting cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as another likely sub-category. The paper also involves learning representations for arguments, which is a common task in machine learning and data mining, suggesting cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as possible sub-categories. Finally, the paper deals with analyzing and improving the performance of the proposed framework, which is a common task in computational social science, suggesting cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as a possible sub-category.
